Reading in my hut one autumn evening, the sudden sound of a pomegranate cracking open riveted my attention. One night when I went out to drink water from the garden tap, I heard a long-haul truck barreling along a distant freeway, and another time, as steam rose around my dishwater, I felt the floor rumble with a passing train.
suggested_query: As I went back to my hut, I noticed a small crack in the wall, which I had never seen before, and I wondered what could have caused it. The sound of the pomegranate still echoed in my mind, and I felt a pang of loneliness wash over me. I walked to the window and looked out at the dark landscape, the only sound being the distant hum of the freeway.
suggest_context: Runners can range from the narrowest strips to very wide bands; they may be soft or hard, in contrasting colours or tone on tone. For example, a marble runner within a wooden floor could form a pathway through a hall and into a living space, perhaps continuing to the fireplace or window; or in a kitchen, dark wood set into a poured-resin floor could be echoed by a worktop or cabinets of the same wood.
